author: Jonathan Lehman
title: Chipper Jones rooting for Mets, because of player he adores
text:
What in the name of Larry is going on here?
Longtime Mets adversary Chipper Jones has booked a seat on the Amazin’s bandwagon , the retired Braves slugger revealed Tuesday, adding to the pigs-in-flight vibe as the team he tormented stands one win from advancing to the National League Championship Series.
“I hate to say this, but I’ve actually found myself kinda rooting for them, to be honest with you,” Jones said on “The Dan Le Batard Show” on ESPN radio.
Mostly because he has a soft spot for one of the Mets stars — though it’s not David Wright, a fellow iconic one-team third baseman.
“Jacob deGrom is from my hometown [DeLand, Fla.], went to Stetson University, where my godfather continues to be the head coach there, same university that my mother and father went to,” Jones said of the Mets’ electric Game 1 winner. “Got a chance to meet him last spring, just think the world of him, so I find myself in a very precarious situation.”
Jacob deGrom induces a pop out during his NLDS Game 1 win for the Mets. Photo: Charles Wenzelberg It seems a stunning turnaround from an opponent whose troll game was once so strong, Le Batard pointed out, he named his son Shea after the site of so many crowd-hushing homers. New, pro-Mets Chipper claims the name came from a Red Sox bit player as much as from the old stadium in Flushing.
“That was not to taunt,” Jones said. “Shea was a place that I truly loved. I loved going there, I loved playing there, I hit my first homer there. A long time ago, there was a guy played in the league named Shea Hillenbrand and I was like, ‘You know what? That’s a pretty cool name. You can have it for a boy or a girl.’ Over time, it’s really gotten blown out of proportion.”
